item.title: 独家报道杰米-戴蒙描绘摩根大通进军非洲的扩张计划
item.description: 美国最大的贷款机构摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）告诉路透社记者，摩根大通计划今年进入肯尼亚和象牙海岸，并扩大其在非洲的足迹。【原文：JPMorgan Chase , the largest U.S. lender, plans to enter Kenya and Ivory Coast this year and grow its footprint in Africa, CEO Jamie Dimon told Reuters.】

item.title: 香港领导人关注民生问题，将香港定位为全球枢纽
item.description: 香港领导人周三发表年度施政报告，承诺改革弊端，包括缩短公屋轮候时间，以加强对民生的关注。【原文：Hong Kong's leader kicked off his annual policy address on Wednesday with pledges to reform shortcomings including a pledge to reduce wait times for public housing as authorities try to bolster their focus on people's livelihoods.】

item.title: 美国大选在即，债务热潮在英国暂停
item.description: 据悉尼的银行家称，澳元债务销售以有史以来最快的速度增长，但随着资本市场为美国大选而缩手缩脚，澳元债务销售开始刹车。【原文：Australian dollar debt sales, running at the fastest clip on record, are starting to hit the brakes as capital markets hunker down for the U.S. election, according to bankers in Sydney.】

item.title: 消息称 KKR 将出售 Goodpack，估值约 18 亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，KKR & Co 公司将启动对总部位于新加坡的 Goodpack 公司的出售交易，该交易可能使这家海运集装箱和物流服务供应商的估值达到 18 亿美元左右。【原文：KKR & Co is set to launch the sale of Singapore-based Goodpack in a deal that could value the provider of shipping containers and logistics services at around $1.8 billion, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 行业打压令前景黯淡，中国金融专业人士纷纷转行
item.description: 中国的银行家和基金经理们正在放弃在金融业的职业生涯，因为政府的宣传和监管给金融业的前景蒙上了一层阴影，以至于教育甚至相声等各种领域似乎更受欢迎。【原文：Disillusioned Chinese bankers and fund managers are giving up careers in a finance sector where government campaigns and regulation have coloured prospects to the extent that areas as varied as education and even stand-up comedy seem preferable.】

item.title: 澳元受中国刺激政策怀疑论影响；美元因美联储前景而坚挺
item.description: 澳元和新西兰元周三下跌，原因是人们对最大的贸易伙伴中国的经济刺激措施持怀疑态度，而美元兑主要同业货币在两个月高位附近徘徊，因为人们担心美国将逐步降息。【原文：The Australian and New Zealand dollars slumped on Wednesday as scepticism grew about top trading partner China's stimulus, while the greenback hovered near two-month peaks versus major peers on wagers U.S. interest rate cuts will be gradual.】

item.title: 日本央行决策者呼吁以 "非常温和 "的步伐加息
item.description: 日本央行决策者足立诚司（Seiji Adachi）周三表示，日本央行必须以 "非常温和 "的步伐提高利率，避免过早加息，并警告说日元进一步升值和全球需求放缓可能会拖累通胀和工资增长。【原文：The Bank of Japan must raise interest rates at a "very moderate" pace and avoid hiking prematurely, its policymaker Seiji Adachi said on Wednesday, warning that further yen rises and slowing global demand may weigh on inflation and wage growth.】

item.title: 芯片股领跌亚洲市场，中国成为焦点
item.description: 欧洲最大的科技公司ASML财报令人失望，拖累了全球芯片股，而美联储将采取温和降息的预期支撑了美元，周三亚洲股市下跌。【原文：Asian equities fell on Wednesday after disappointing earnings from Europe's biggest tech firm ASML dragged chip stocks around the world, while expectations that the Federal Reserve will take a modest rate cut path propped up the dollar.】

item.title: 中东不确定性持续存在，石油暴跌后企稳
item.description: 周三，石油在亚洲早盘交易中上涨，原因是中东冲突的不确定性仍在持续，此前由于需求担忧，本周石油一度下跌多达 5 美元，跌至 10 月初以来的最低水平。【原文：Oil rose in early Asian trade on Wednesday on continued uncertainty over conflict in the Middle East, after falling as much as $5 this week to the lowest levels since early October on demand concerns.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Stellantis 计划在墨西哥生产公羊皮卡
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二报道，克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特正在扩建其位于墨西哥北部的工厂，以生产公羊 1500 皮卡。【原文：Chrysler parent Stellantis is expanding its factory complex in northern Mexico to build Ram 1500 pickup trucks, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: ASML 下调展望表明工厂产能过剩，而非芯片末日
item.description: 计算机芯片设备制造商 ASML 大幅下调了 2025 年的销售预期，引发了周二芯片类股的抛售，原因是担心全球芯片需求可能会出现衰退。【原文：Computer chip equipment maker ASML's deep cuts to its 2025 sales forecast sparked a sell-off in chip stocks on Tuesday over worries that global chip demand may be faltering.】

item.title: 美联储博斯蒂克称他的 "点 "是在 2024 年再削减 25 个基点
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周二在更新他对上个月美国央行会议的预测时表示，他预计今年只会再降息一次，降息幅度为 25 个基点。【原文：Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic on Tuesday said he penciled in just one more interest rate reduction of 25 basis points this year when he updated his projections for last month's U.S. central bank meeting.】

item.title: 加拿大劳工部长提议为蒙特利尔港口工人罢工设立新的调解人
item.description: 加拿大海事雇主协会周二表示，劳工部长史蒂夫-麦金农（Steve MacKinnon）已提议任命一名特别调解员，在该工会和蒙特利尔码头工人工会之间进行为期 90 天的调解。【原文：Canada's Maritime Employers Association said on Tuesday Labour Minister Steve MacKinnon had proposed the appointment of a special mediator for a 90-day period between the union and the Montréal Longshoremen's Union.】

item.title: 美国法官命令波音公司和司法部在决定认罪前详细说明多元化政策
item.description: 一名联邦法官周二命令波音公司和美国司法部在决定是否接受该飞机制造商的认罪协议之前，详细说明多元化和包容性政策对选择独立监督员的影响。【原文：A federal judge on Tuesday ordered Boeing and the U.S. Justice Department to detail the impact of diversity and inclusion policies on the selection of an independent monitor before he decides whether to accept the planemaker's plea deal.】

item.title: 派拉蒙保证即使联席首席执行官离职也能获得奖金
item.description: 根据周二提交的一份文件，派拉蒙全球公司董事会已批准向其三位联席首席执行官发放之前宣布的年度奖金，即使他们不再是公司的掌舵人。【原文：Paramount Global's board has approved awarding the previously declared annual bonus payments for its three co-CEOs even if they are no longer at the helm, according to a filing on Tuesday.】

item.title: 电信巨头 America Movil 第三季度净利润增长三倍
item.description: 墨西哥电信巨头 America Movil 周二发布报告称，由于比索疲软增加了国外收入，而且融资成本降低，该公司第三季度净利润比去年同期增长了两倍多。【原文：Mexican telecommunications giant America Movil reported on Tuesday that it more than tripled its net profit in the third quarter from a year ago, citing a weaker peso boosting its foreign earnings and lower financing costs.】

item.title: 亚洲：科技和石油下滑，央行三度出手
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 达美航空将暂停纽约与特拉维夫之间的航班，直至三月
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）周二表示，由于以色列冲突升级和安全问题，该公司将暂停纽约肯尼迪机场和特拉维夫之间的航班，直至三月。【原文：Delta Air Lines said on Tuesday it will pause its flights between New York's JFK airport and Tel Aviv through March, due to escalating conflict and safety concerns in Israel.】

item.title: 纽约银行将其子公司更名为 Flagstar Financial
item.description: 纽约社区银行（New York Community Bancorp）周二表示，该公司已更名为旗星金融公司（Flagstar Financial），股票代码也改为 "FLG"。【原文：New York Community Bancorp said on Tuesday it has changed its name to Flagstar Financial and its stock symbol to "FLG."】

item.title: Wisk Aero 与澳大利亚航空服务公司合作，准备推出空中出租车
item.description: 波音公司旗下的威斯克航空（Wisk Aero）周二表示，该公司已与澳大利亚政府机构澳大利亚航空服务公司（Airservices Australia）合作，研究如何将空中出租车和其他自动驾驶飞机整合到该国的空域中。【原文：Boeing-owned Wisk Aero said on Tuesday it has partnered with government agency Airservices Australia to study how air taxis and other autonomous aircraft can be integrated into the country's airspace.】

item.title: 特朗普称总统应参与美联储利率决策，但不应下令
item.description: 美国共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二似乎软化了他在干预美联储政策决定问题上的立场，称他认为自己作为总统有权告诉美联储他认为美联储应该在利率问题上做些什么--但他不会下令采取行动。【原文：U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on Tuesday appeared to soften his position on inserting himself into Federal Reserve policy decisions, saying he believes he would have a right as president to tell the Fed what he thought it should do about interest rates - but he would not order a move.】

item.title: Meta 必须面对美国各州关于青少年沉迷社交媒体的诉讼
item.description: 美国加州一名联邦法官周二裁定，Facebook 母公司 Meta 必须面对美国各州指控其鼓励青少年沉迷社交媒体的诉讼。【原文：Facebook parent company Meta must face lawsuits by U.S. states accusing it of encouraging social media addiction among teens, a federal judge in California ruled on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司利润增长，制定股票回购计划
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）周二预计，本季度利润将高于预期，此前由于定价能力提高，该公司第三季度盈利超过了华尔街的预期。【原文：United Airlines on Tuesday forecast a stronger-than-expected profit in the current quarter, after third-quarter earnings topped Wall Street estimates on improved pricing power.】

item.title: 美国对阿拉巴马州涉嫌种族歧视的抵押贷款机构 Fairway 进行处罚
item.description: 美国司法部和消费者金融保护局周二表示，因涉嫌在阿拉巴马州伯明翰的黑人区实施红线政策，对 Fairway Independent Mortgage Corporation 进行了处罚。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau penalized Fairway Independent Mortgage Corporation for alleged redlining in Black neighborhoods in Birmingham, Alabama, the agencies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 陪审团裁定，J&J 公司必须向康涅狄格州一名称其滑石粉致癌的男子赔偿 1500 万美元
item.description: 强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）必须向一名康涅狄格州男子支付 1,500 万美元，该男子声称，由于几十年来一直使用该公司生产的滑石粉，他患上了间皮瘤（一种罕见的癌症）。【原文：Johnson & Johnson must pay $15 million to a Connecticut man who alleges that he developed mesothelioma, a rare form of cancer, as a result of using the company's talc powder for decades, a jury found on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中国股市具有吸引力，但投资经理在美国大选前持谨慎态度
item.description: 一位投资顾问说，公募和私募基金的资产经理们认为，某些中国股票的交易价格很有吸引力，但由于即将到来的美国大选存在不确定性，他们现在还不会买入。【原文：Asset managers of public and private funds believe that certain Chinese stocks are trading at attractive prices, but they are not buying just yet because of uncertainty around the upcoming U.S. elections, an investment adviser said.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局开始对美国 45 个最繁忙机场的跑道入侵风险进行审计
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周二表示，在发生了一系列令人不安的险情后，该局正在对美国 45 个最繁忙机场的跑道入侵风险展开审计。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration said Tuesday it is opening an audit into runway incursion risks at the 45 busiest U.S. airports after a series of troubling near miss incidents.】

item.title: 埃克森为北达科他州巴肯页岩的部分资产寻找买家
item.description: 美国最大的石油生产商埃克森美孚公司周二告诉路透社，该公司计划出售其在北达科他州巴肯页岩层的部分资产。【原文：Top U.S. oil producer Exxon Mobil Corp plans to sell a portion of its assets in North Dakota's Bakken shale formation, the company told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道 世界银行采取行动，在 10 年内将贷款能力提高 300 亿美元
item.description: 世界银行行长阿贾伊-班加（Ajay Banga）告诉路透社记者，迫于帮助发展中国家应对气候变化的压力，世界银行周二投票决定修改其内部贷款准则，以便在未来十年内释放出 300 亿美元的额外贷款能力。【原文：The World Bank, under pressure to do more to help developing countries cope with climate change, voted on Tuesday to change its internal lending guidelines to free up $30 billion in additional lending capacity over the next decade, World Bank President Ajay Banga told Reuters.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体在交易量最大的一个交易日延续反弹势头
item.description: 美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体公司股价周二大涨 6%，达到 6 月份以来的最高点，这是 Truth Social 平台 3 月份在华尔街首次亮相以来交易量最大的一个交易日。【原文：Shares of former U.S. President Donald Trump's media company surged 6% on Tuesday to their highest since June in one of the heaviest trading sessions since the Truth Social platform's Wall Street debut in March.】
